name: The Westin Chicago River North

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Westin over 4th of July weekend for an anniversary trip/babymoon. I've traveled all over but never stayed at the Westin, and would highly recommend this property. We arrived around 11, checked in and were upgraded to a room with club level access (free continental breakfast, evening appetizers, and gym). The woman at the counter was lovely and really friendly. The room was great - the bed was indeed Heavenly, though I've seen more impressive bathrooms. We had a computer with free wireless in the room, but it didn't work, and I was charged for a call to the help desk. Small inconvenience, really, because there was also a computer in the club lounge. Breakfast was great- espresso machine, assorted juices, milk, cereal, hardboiled eggs, salted meats and cheeses, pastries and bagels, and fruit. The appetizers in the evening were less impressive, but still nice.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Westin

reviews.text: The hotel has a great location right on the river - there are tons of great restaurants within a few blocks. We used the concierge George for restaurant reservations and architecture tour booking, and both were great. Overall, great room, excellent location, great staff. Would absolutely return.
reviews.title: Will not return

reviews.text: We are loyal Westin fans and Starwood members, but were terribly disappointed with this hotel. We booked online through hotel website and were asked if we cared to upgrade to Executive accommodation that included continental breakfast, internet, health club, etc. Foolishly, we did. When we arrived there was no valet to open doors or help with luggage. Nor was any other staff member willing to do more than watch us struggle in through revolving door,. The front desk staff informed us that they found two rooms in our name and were insistent that we pay for 2nd room since it was not canceled within the deadline. After much discussion we asked to speak with manager and they promised a call when he/she was available. Next they told us our room was not available and none on that level were cleaned as yet (3:30 PM). By 5:00 PM we settled for a 2-double bed instead of king room so we could change in time for dinner reservations. Never heard from manager. For the following two days endured terrible service and were happy to leave. At check out we again inquired about extra room charge and were told it was taken care of, but we'll see. Definitely not up to Westin standards.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has gone under renovation and the rooms and bathrooms are very nice. We were staying at the hotel for a Wedding. The Wedding was held completely at the hotel. The hotel managed everything. It was so beautiful! The restaurant at the hotel was very good. It is called the Ember Grille and we had a nice breakfast there. The room had a small view of the river. I liked that the hotel was central to many of the great places to go on foot. Directly across from the hotel is the House of Blues. The hotel has a nice lounge in the center with a bar.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: My husband and I live in the Chicago burbs and wanted to book a weekend to get away downtown. We've stayed in several Chicago hotels over the years, the Westin River North is at the top of the list. Next time we stay downtown, this will be the first hotel we will try to book.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a great weekend stay here. This hotel was formerly a Hotel Nikko. A very nice property, we stayed on a club floor (19) which included use of the executive lounge which we did 2 times once at breakfast & once for a cocktail. Very nice but sort of crowded at breakfast.
reviews.title: Perfect Weekend Getaway

likes.liked: — great location, great view, complementary internet/computer in room, heavenly bed
likes.disliked: — it was expensive even with our coupon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was huge, a nice view of the river & the Marina City towers, comfortable Heavenly bed, with the temp set at 65 as requested (we are Starwood points members) and all the usual amenities. We used the minibar as a fridge and our supply of napkins and clean glasses was replenished. I don't think we got turndown service one of the 3 nights but that was probably ok we were pretty out of it when we got home that night (after drinks, steak dinner & more drinks!)
reviews.title: Great City-Great Hotel-Okay Service

reviews.text: Chicago is a really great city - can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Amazingly central... yet so quiet!

reviews.text: Chicago is such a great City. I have never been to a cleaner more friendly large city, like Chicago. On to the hotel review.....................
reviews.title: Has potential to be a nice hotel, but misses the mark....

reviews.text: Westin River North
reviews.title: Prime Location!

reviews.text: We booked a two-night "Romance Package" to shop and play in Chicago. This included a king bed, river view room, coupons for an American breakfast, a bottle of champagne and strawberries, and a 4 p.m. late-checkout. The room was spacious and the view very nice. Bathroom was also luxurious, with the "heavenly" showerhead. (Just be sure it's set to your liking before you step in! It's powerful.) There were a few minor glitches. The champagne and strawberries we requested never arrived the first night, but we decided to go out to dinner anyway, and so had them sent up the next night. In the morning we found only decaf coffee and one paper cup in the room. There was also no bathrobe in the room. The full American breakfast coupons were worth $10 each and you could select only that from the menu (2 eggs, sausage or bacon, toast, etc.) It was fine but we used the coupons only the first morning - went to brunch at the Palmer House on Sunday instead. It was a pleasant stay and we most liked the late check-out - gave us time to squeeze in more shopping (without having to hassle with packing and retrieving our car right away) before heading home. Staff was quite friendly. We usually stay in a corner room at the Swissotel but tried this just for a change. I like the location of the Swisshotel better, but have always found their staff are pretty chilly.
reviews.title: pleasant getaway
Westin River North Redefines Class
reviews.text: Recently or more truthfully, I am in the middle of what I expected to be a pleasant experience at the Westin River North Hotel in Chicago. I've stayed here numerous times over the past years, even when it was the old Nikko-but it has improved so dramatically over the past year I felt compelled to write. The Front Desk Manager Steve Johnson personally checked me in, maybe because I am a Platinum member I thought, but I saw him pitching in with the overall check-in process which made even a large crowd of people's check in experience as smooth as mine which was during an unhurried period. I used the lobby quite a bit to work as it has internet connectivity as well as my room did, and had a nice loungelike atmosphere. Food and drink were fine, nothing spectacular here but fine nonetheless. But then Mr. Johnson invited me to the SPG lounge on the 19th floor-I think this is reserved for SPG Gold or Platinum members, I'm not sure, but it really made me feel like I was in a Ritz Carlton as opposed to the Westin and it only got better from there. During my stay I was greeted by name by many of the staff ranging from the bellmen Allen and James as well as Mr. Johnson who made my otherwise normally pleasant experience into one that made me feel a VIP from start to finish. Great job Westin and thanks for making me feel like an honored guest and acting in what I way that I can only say redefines the word class.
My wife and I are Chicagoans currently living in Switzerland, and we stayed at the Westin while on a recent business/visiting family and friends trip back to the Windy City in October 2005.
reviews.title: You Can Go Home Again!

reviews.text: Overall, I really enjoyed this hotel. At check-in we were offered access to the business level (I can't really remember what it's called) for $60/day. I think it gave us unlimited high-speed internet, access to the business level and the fitness room. The business lounge is OK. I guess it's a nice place to unwind, but the food isn't that great, AND they charge you for drinks. I think the price should AT LEAST include a free drink.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The positives:
reviews.title: A dream came true

reviews.text: We travelled from Fort Lauderdale to Chicago for the New Year's weekend. We could not have been more pleased with the Westin Chicago River North. We were in Chicago in May 2005 and stayed at Hotel 71. No comparison. The Westin is so much better. Cleaner, better elevators, nicer lobby, better rooms. New Year's Eve the security was tight so no one that wasn't staying at the hotel couldn't get to the elevators. Great location as we walked to Marshall-Fields, the Ford Theatre and pretty much everywhere we wanted to go. And only 2 blocks to Lou Malnati's -some of the best Chicago deep dish pizza! Will definitely stay at the Westin Chicago River North again.
reviews.title: New Year's Weekend

reviews.text: We really enjoyed the elegant, spare Asian decor in the public areas of the hotel. Our room was nice too, but not as nice. There was water damage on the ceiling and some disrepair in the corner wall of the bathroom, but the room was very comfortable wth romantic views of the river.
reviews.title: Elegant but Some Front Desk Issues

reviews.text: The restaurant has a great breakfast & service was impeccable. The bar area is very nice. The bellhops were all quick and helpful--really gracious.
reviews.title: Good business hotel
Love The River North.
reviews.text: The front desk staff was weirdly off the ball. The person at the front desk was rather rude, but we brushed that off. When we got to our room, though, it turned out she had actually given us a room that was already occupied! There were people asleep in bed! The bellman was horrified and rushed to the phone in the hallway to straighten things out. From what we could hear, she was rude to him too. A day later we found they had our check out date wrong (we got our bill under the door a day early, though they had the date right when we checked in). Lastly, after we checked out, we discovered that they had not billed the room charges to the proper credit card.

reviews.title: great weekend at the westin !
reviews.text: Note that the location is really great for theatre-going, though a little far for walking to and from the Water Tower shopping area.

I have stayed at this hotel twice now and really like it. I find it relatively quiet and has wonderful views of the river-- so try to get a room with a river view!! I have switched from the loop W which was a bit to kinetic and like this hotel's convenient but not right in the middle of everything location. I tend to take the blue line in from ohare and is a very short work from the clark an lake stop.
reviews.title: would definitely stay again

reviews.text: My room has always been spacious, and very attractive but as someone else wrote not over the top. The hotel was formally a Nikko and still has a slight zen asian look.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but would Hesitate to Stay Here Again

reviews.text: I stayed here for three and a half days to attend a conference and most of the time was very pleased with the hotel. Although rooms are a little dark, they are unusually large and quite comfortable. The Westin River North has a sleek modern ambiance and is a much better hotel than the Westin on Michigan Avenue, which seemed somewhat run-down when I stayed there last fall. Even though the Michigan Avenue hotel has a better location if you are in Chicago to shop, I liked the location of the Westin River North as it is right on the river, with easy access to the Loop, but also there are lots of good restaurants nearby, and it’s an easy walk to the shops of Michigan Ave.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: The one aspect of the hotel that really bothered me is that they charge you an extra $10 for the use of their fitness facility. I have stayed at Westin hotels all over the country and have never encountered an additional charge to use one of their gyms. Since you are already paying top dollar to stay here, I think that they are highly out of line to submit guests to this additional charge. There are lots of hotels to choose from in Chicago, so I would probably go elsewhere on my next business trip.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a City of Great hotels

reviews.text: My daughter, her friend, her Aunt, and myself, stayed at this hotel 4/28-4/30. It was a surprise for my daughter's 16th bday. We were already booked club level, but they did give us an upgrade to a corner room with a beautiful view of the water and city. Club level was good, not great. The breakfast was continental and there were snacks (pretzels, fresh fruit, etc) during the day. In the evening, hors d'oeveres (sp) little pizzas, fried artichokes (yum). Alcoholic bevs were extra. This was my first experience with paying for alcohol in club. It was spacious there with a few plasma tv's and computer.
reviews.title: Central for restaurants, sites & shopping

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a prime location, but the hotel does not add up to the quality of the location, the room was just O.K. the restaurant was not good at all for the money, the food was sub par, the flavors on the dishes did not work well and not taste good, the waitstaff is horrible, did not see any management to discuss it with, this is probably a hotel that I see is poorly managed, to give this kind of food.This happens a lot in hotels, that is why hotel restaurants have a bad name, I also attende a banquet here and the food tasted badly, it was like they do not care.
reviews.title: Only thing going is location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were very impressed with the room, staff, and lobby at the Westin River North. Our room was very spacious, had a great view with a chase lounger to enjoy it, had a very nice bathroom (the dual shower heads in the bath were a definitely plus), and the flat-panel TV was great too. Also, our check-in experience was quick and the woman was friendly and professional. Finally, the location was perfect for us as tourists! Very nice walks along the river, and we ambled over to a great place for dinner, Shaw's Crab House.
reviews.title: Amazing stay at the Westin River North!

reviews.text: Our great experience at the Westin was in stark contrast to the terrible experience at the Palmer House Hilton the night before (we switched hotels b/c of bad planning, but now we're glad we did make the move to the Westin!).
reviews.title: Would make some changes at the Westin

reviews.text: I was at the Westin in early June of 2008 for a convention. They had a huge problem with the air conditioning not working and the weather was very hot and humid. It took 3 days before my room was cooled down.
reviews.title: A great stay

likes.disliked: — Fitness center had a fee, average toiletries

reviews.text: The one big complaint I have about the Westin are all the additional charges:
reviews.title: One of the Best SPG Property In Town!
Clean hotel, fabulous location
reviews.text: Stayed here after attending a wedding in the hotel. Overall, a positive experience. The rooms were fairly large, clean, and we were given a prime view of the Chicago River. The hotel's location is one of it's best assets. We were in walking distance of Millennium Park, Michigan Ave., and right across the street from the House of Blues.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaints are the $42 charge for overnight parking (I know it's downtown Chicago, but c'mon ... that's very high) and the not-so-heavenly bed (I've stayed at other Westins, and somehow this bed wasn't quite up to snuff).
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Specials, Best way to see Chicago!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After searching for hours online for different hotels, the Westin made the most sense. So I called up the hotel directly instead of buying online, and wound up getting a great deal. Just ask about their specials... The woman that helped me book was wonderful, and made a note to upgrade my wife and I and treat us with VIP service... Sure enough when we arrived they did. We were upgraded to club member status, and were given a top level club suite. The view was slightly blocked by Marina City Towers (just across the street), but looking out the bedroom we could look down upon the Chicago River that banks on the hotel.
reviews.title: Very Good

likes.disliked: — Patchy internet access; no option to have breakfast

reviews.text: The room was huge. It was a suite, so it was a combination of 2 rooms: a living room and a door into the bedroom on the other side. The living room was spacious with a couch and flat-panel TV, along with a bar and a desk/office area with a iMac computer with internet access (which was helpful in finding things to do). The bedroom was in the next room with a sexy chase lounge, a very comfortable bed, and a huge bathroom. The bed was so comfortable that I am now looking into buying one of them - which i believe the Westin claims to sell - or they just slap their name on them, anyway they are fantastic.
reviews.title: Overall Quite Satisfied

reviews.text: The location, is probably one of the best features of this hotel, if your familiar with Chicago - this is right in the heart of the River North area, across the street from the House of Blues and Marina City Towers. Within walking to everything, you won't need to waive any taxis down, just pack a comfortable pair of shoes and enjoy the city!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I stay at Starwood properties constantly. I used to love the service, and I am one of those model customers - stay 30+ times per year, never complain, etc., but things are progressively deteriorating. My recent problems at the Westin River North are small, but continue the downward trend.
reviews.title: Am I being fired?

reviews.text: 1. After staying at Starwood properties for close to 30 nights, I tried to use my points to book a personal stay - only to discover I had none. According to "customer service" all of my points were going to an airline, and they claimed I had authorized this. I asked for proof - a signed paper, an email form, anything - but they refused to provide any, and refused to give me my points back.
reviews.title: Great location, overall good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. I originally was upgraded to a concierge level at every stay - once I corrected their mistake on the airline and began collecting actual Starwood points for real, those upgrades stopped. At the West River North, I was dropped down to the preferred level, and then to the regular level. For some reason, I stopped receiving the benefits that I had supposedly earned as a regular customer - free water, free internet, free health club access - all gone.
reviews.title: Nice Westin in a good location

reviews.text: 3. When I went to Westin's front desk to let them know about minor housekeeping issues - i.e., I didn't get a bottle of water, the soap was thrown away each night, and someone's used hair tie went from the floor into my back of hair supplies (ick). I was pretty nice about it - just "here's an FYI for your housekeeping staff." The attendant's response was to roll her eyes, tell me the water was the mini-bar's responsibility, and ask why I was complaining about the soap being thrown away. I had to ask whether they had ever heard of the environment in Chicago
reviews.title: Nice downtown hotel in good location

reviews.text: For those of you who wonder, take 100 rooms * 2 bars of soap per night * 365 days per year * the number of hotels in Chicago, and ask yourself if you want that in your water supply. I've stayed in hotels (including the Westin) enough to know they usually don't throw away the soap if the same person stays in the room.
reviews.title: Very nice place

aka: The Westin Chicago River North Hotel
description: The Westin Chicago River North allows guests a chance to experience relaxation and renewal while maintaining access to all of their favorite Chicago activities.
